title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not describe the trend in electricity production from wind between 2009 and 2019, such as any of the following:

· The electricity produced from wind increased significantly between 2009 and 2019.

· The percent of electricity generated from wind increased from approximately 6% in 2009 to approximately 20% in 2019.

· The percent of electricity generated from wind power increased by approximately 13% from 2009 to 2019.

The response describes the trend in electricity production from wind between 2009 and 2019, such as one of the following:

· The electricity produced from wind increased significantly between 2009 and 2019.

· The percent of electricity generated from wind increased from approximately 6% in 2009 to approximately 20% in 2019.

· The percent of electricity generated from wind power increased by approximately 13% from 2009 to 2019.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not identify and describe one nonrenewable energy source that could be used in electricity production in the state of Texas that was not being used in 2009, such as any of the following:

· Oil/petroleum/petroleum products can be burned as a fuel in a power plant to generate electricity.

· The combustion of oil can be used to heat water to its boiling point, and then the steam is sent through a steam turbine, which then generates electricity.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not explain how government subsidies for energy production by wind power in the form of a consumer tax credit would affect the energy production by natural gas in 2030 in Texas, such as the following:

· Electricity generated by natural gas in Texas would likely continue to decline if subsidies were provided to facilities using wind power because there would be increased investment in wind energy/increased cost for natural gas electricity generation, which would make it less economically viable for energy production.

The response explains how government subsidies for energy production by wind power in the form of a consumer tax credit would affect the energy production by natural gas in 2030 in Texas, such as the following:

· Electricity generated by natural gas in Texas would likely continue to decline if subsidies were provided to facilities using wind power because there would be increased investment in wind energy/increased cost for natural gas electricity generation, which would make it less economically viable for energy production.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not describe one negative impact of poor air quality on human health that would be amplified in Los Angeles because of the number of days with hazardous levels of tropospheric ozone, such as the following:

· Higher levels of tropospheric ozone in Los Angeles can also lead to increased episodes of photochemical smog, which can cause or exacerbate respiratory problems, more frequent asthmas attacks, and/or eye irritation.

title: Part I
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not describe a realistic alternative sampling method to collect particulate matter from the vehicles in the investigation, such as any of the following:

· Use double-sided tape attached to a surface like a small piece of glass, placed a specific distance from the tailpipe for a specific length of time.

· Use filter (paper, fiberglass, or tissue paper) attached to a stick held a specific distance from the tailpipe for a specific length of time.

title: Part J
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not explain how the student could modify the experimental design to make the results of the investigation more reliable, such as any of the following:

· The student could repeat the results for several days in a row and average the results for each type of vehicle.

· The student could have multiple cars/buses of each type to increase the sample size in each group.

· The student could vary collection time from five minutes within a reasonable range.

· Adding a described control group of fabric exposed only to background air.
